pullRequest.body:
Added some lemmas in preparation for Tuttes theorem

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

[Zulip thread on Tuttes](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Tutte's.20theorem)

I put this in a new file, because Data.Set.Card is already fairly long and this seems somewhat coherent, but I'm also open to adding it there if that makes more sense:)

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10815262003/job/30003714958)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10815262003/job/30003715978)

Thanks! 

maintainer merge
Please merge master
One more; LGTM otherwise

Thanks! 

maintainer merge
This lemma is very specific and doesn't seem much easier to apply that the one with `two_le`.
Fair enough, removed it:)
Why are you using `Nat.card` on sets?
Because I standardized on it in my staging area, I guess using `ncard` makes more sense here, changed to that:)

```suggestion
This file contains lemmas concerning finite sets and the parity of their cardinality.
```
Perhaps this could go a bit more in depth about the scope of the file? Or, if these are the two only theorems you plan on adding, maybe they can be moved elsewhere? Perhaps to the same file of the rest of your proof.
The vast majority of the rest of the proof would be in Combinatorics.SimpleGraph, so if you think a separate file is overkill, I'd say Data.Set.Card is the most likely alternative.
In refactoring the code became even smaller, so I moved it to Data.Set.Card

My first instinct seeing this theorem is that it might be better stated in the other direction. That is, `Even u → Even (insert x (insert y u))`. Of course, this is pretty trivial as the latter set has cardinality `2` more than the former. I think the usefulness of this is contingent on whichever proof you want to use it on, and even then, I'd ask if the `insert` form can't be used instead.

Given the arguments, I'd suggest two lemmas, relating Even s or Odd s to the opposite for ‘insert x s‘.
And maybe an additional that proves that y does not belong to insert x s iff...

> Given the arguments, I'd suggest two lemmas, relating Even s or Odd s to the opposite for ‘insert x s‘. And maybe an additional that proves that y does not belong to insert x s iff...

This seems really clean. I'm about to go on holiday for a week, but I'll refactor to this afterwards:)
Adopted this:)

```suggestion
  rw [ncard_insert_of_not_mem ha hs, Nat.even_add_one, Nat.not_even_iff_odd]
```

```suggestion
  have : 0 < s.ncard := (Set.ncard_pos hs).mpr hn
```
or
```suggestion
  rw [← Set.ncard_pos hs] at hn
```
Fixed:)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Set/Finite): added lemmas about cardinality of finite sets
